abstracts.cdata!:
The overall project as a demonstration
            and pilot effort was fully satisfactory. Project
            sustainability is rated likely. The overall World Bank
            performance was satisfactory: Despite the shortfall in
            supervision resources, the Bank team provided significant
            support to the Borrower. Overall Borrower performance was
            satisfactory, also: The Government provided provided
            financial and implementation support to ensure effective
            project implementation. Some of the lessons learned include
            the following: The project was well-designed, but key
            milestone surveys were conducted at a time when few loans
            were taken and the process was not fully tested.
            Well-defined operational procedures are essential for pilot
            projects to generate experiences such that performance
            measures are meaningful at completion. However well-prepared
            they are, projects whose main purpose is to change
            people's behavior through new experiences will by
            definition be slow to begin, and moreover, slow to disburse.
            Homeowners Associations (HOA) are able to renovate common
            property if provided with institutional support, technical
            support, and financial incentives. Proper legal and
            regulatory framework is mandatory for facilitating formation
            of HOAs and energy efficiency investments. Significant
            institutional support and financial incentives are needed to
            reduce the transaction costs associated with addressing
            barriers to the formation of HOAs and to private initiative
            in maintaining residential buildings.
